comment.author: 22694125@N02
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called artland, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 9128038@N03
comment._content:
I'm fairly certain that the fish is not a Bonita. 
It looks to me like it could be a Yellowtail.

comment.author: 31846825@N04
comment._content: Thanks for the contribution, samuelito5277, and thanks for visiting the Florida Memory photostream. The historical record has been changed to reflect the new information. After additional research, we determined that the fish is indeed not a Bonito. It is probably a Greater Amberjack, a species related to the Yellowtail, but found in the Atlantic.
comment.authorname: State Library and Archives of Florida

comment.author: 9128038@N03
comment._content:
Yes, I forgot that Yellowtail weren't an Atlantic fish.
Thanks for changing it! This photostream is fantastic. Definitely worth more than a quick click through...
